intro: Strobilanthes barbigera, commonly known as the hairy strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive hairy leaves and vibrant blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests and is often found in the understory of dense vegetation. Its blooming period occurs during the rainy season, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
